SEARCH
Module com.example.dicegame
Package db

Class GameDatabase

java.lang.Object
db.GameDatabase
public class GameDatabase extends Object
Singleton class that handles all database operations for the game.

This class provides methods to save and load player data (specifically, a HumanPlayer) to and from an SQLite database. The player data is serialized into a Base64-encoded string for storage.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameDatabase

      private GameDatabase()
      Private constructor for initializing the database. Creates the player_data table if it does not exist.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static GameDatabase getInstance()
      Retrieves the singleton instance of the GameDatabase.
      Returns:
      the singleton instance of the GameDatabase

    • connect

      private Connection connect() throws SQLException
      Establishes a connection to the SQLite database.
      Returns:
      a Connection object to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • initDatabase

      private void initDatabase()
      Initializes the game database, creating the necessary table if it does not already exist. Specifically, it creates the player_data table for storing serialized player data.

    • save

      public void save(HumanPlayer player)
      Saves the provided HumanPlayer object to the database. If player data already exists, it will be updated.
      Parameters:
      player - the player object to save

    • load

      public HumanPlayer load()
      Loads the player data from the database.
      Returns:
      the HumanPlayer object if found, or null if no data exists

    • serializePlayer

      private String serializePlayer(HumanPlayer player)
      Serializes a HumanPlayer object into a Base64-encoded string.
      Parameters:
      player - the player object to serialize
      Returns:
      a Base64-encoded string representing the serialized player data

    • deserializePlayer

      private HumanPlayer deserializePlayer(String data)
      Deserializes the Base64-encoded player data into a HumanPlayer object.
      Parameters:
      data - the Base64-encoded string representing the player data
      Returns:
      a HumanPlayer object or null if deserialization fails
